monogr.title: Three formes of catechismes : conteyning the most principall pointes of religion. R.H
monogr.author: Harrison, Robert

div.head: To the Reader.
div.p: THou hast here (Christian Reader) in this litle booke, three Catechismes. The first setting forth the cheife pointes of religion somewhat at large. The seconde gathering the same in to a shorter sūme, for their memories sake, which are not able to committe to harte the longer.

The thirde very short, for the alluring of weake and crased memories, as of aged folke, and such like, which at least may soone learne those foure wordes, and the meaning of them, and be brought to saye some thinge of them by their owne knowledge. There be very many Catechismes, thou knowest (good Reader) and in very many of them (in my iudgement) a good & perfect order wanting, for beginning where they shoulde beginne, and endinge where they should ende, and making thinges followe in their due course. I submitte my selfe also to the iudgement of others. Peraduenture manye wyll so thinke of these. Therefore I leaue it free to thee to chuse, vntill thou finde that forme of Catechisme, which thou thinkest to agree most aptlye to thy minde, which thou art best able to followe in instructing thy househoulde. If thou shalt take anye profite by these, giue God the glorie.
